snippet: President Hamid Karzai’s contacts with the Taliban about reaching a peace deal could explain why he has held up a security deal, straining his relationship with the United States.
abstract: Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai has been engaged in secret contacts with the Taliban about reaching peace agreement without involvement of his American and Western allies, further corroding already strained relations with United States; contacts appear to help explain string of actions by Karzai that seem intended to antagonize his American backers.

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and MATTHEW ROSENBERG
byline.contributor: Peter Baker contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: President Hamid Karzai’s contacts with the Taliban about reaching a peace deal could explain why he has held up a security deal, straining his relationship with the United States.

headline.main: Karzai Arranged Secret Contacts With the Taliban
headline.print_headline: Karzai Arranged Secret Contacts With the Taliban
